info.title: PushPress Platform API
info.description:
The PushPress Platform API provides a comprehensive suite of endpoints designed 
to facilitate seamless integration with the PushPress ecosystem. 
This API allows developers to interact programmatically with the PushPress platform, 
enabling the automation of various tasks and the extension of platform capabilities.

apiKey.name: API-KEY
apiKey.description: Primary authentication mechanism for the platform

bearer.description: JWT Bearer Token primarily used to provision access to the platform

id.description: Unique identifier for the checkin record

customer.description: UUID of the customer who checked in

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp representing the time of checkin

enrollmentId.description: UUID of the enrollment record, null if the checkin is not associated with a plan enrollment

name.description: Name of the class that the customer checked into

source.description: Source of the checkin provided at checkin time, (e.g kiosk, staff app), will be an empty string when the source was not provided

result.description: Indicates if the customer was permitted to check into the class, for details about any failures, see failureReason

failureReason.description: Only populated when a checkin fails, a message containing details about why the failure occurred

id.description: UUID of the class type

name.description: Descriptive name of the class type

type.description: Detailed information about the type of the class

kind.description: Indicates that this checkin is for a class

role.description: Role of the customer in the class

ClassCheckin.description: Schema representing a checkin for a class

id.description: Unique identifier for the checkin record

customer.description: UUID of the customer who checked in

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp representing the time of checkin

enrollmentId.description: UUID of the enrollment record, null if the checkin is not associated with a plan enrollment

name.description: The name or title of the appointment, if available

kind.description: A constant value indicating the type of check-in, which is 'appointment'

appointmentId.description: UUID for the checked in appointment

typeId.description: The UUID representing the type or category of the appointment

staffId.description: unique identifier for the staff member, corresponding to a customer with a staff role

AppointmentCheckin.description: Schema for checking in to an appointment, including relevant details such as customer and company information

Checkin.description: Checkin for a class, event, appointment or an open facility

id.description: Unique identifier for the class

assistantCoachUuid.description: Unique identifier for the assistant coach, if any

locationUuid.description: Unique identifier for the location, if any

location.description: Location information about where the class took place

start.description: Start time of the event as a Unix timestamp in seconds

end.description: End time of the event as a Unix timestamp in seconds

Class.description: Schema for representing a scheduled class

id.description: Unique identifier for the event

access.description: an invite_only event restricts registration to people who have been invited

assistantCoachUuid.description: Unique identifier for the assistant coach, if any

locationUuid.description: Unique identifier for the location, if any

location.description: Location information about where the event took place

start.description: Start time of the event as a Unix timestamp in seconds

end.description: End time of the event as a Unix timestamp in seconds

isAllDay.description: Whether the event is an all-day event

Event.description: Schema for representing a scheduled class

id.description: unique identifier for the appointment

isLateCancel.description: True when the appointment was canceled late

startTimestamp.description: Unix timestamp for the start time of the appointment

staffId.description: unique identifier for the staff member, corresponding to a customer with a staff role

Appointment.description: Schema for representing a Regsitration for some scheduled event

id.description: Unique identifier for the subscription

interval.description: The number of periods between bills

startDate.description: Date format string of start date

endDate.description: Date format string of end date e.g. 2022-01-01

lastCharge.description: Date format string of last charge date e.g. 2022-01-01

nextCharge.description: Date format string of next charge date e.g. 2022-01-01

paidUntil.description: Date format string of paid until date e.g. 2022-01-01

checkins.description: Number of times the customer has checked in in the current checkin period

limit.description: number of checkins allowable for the checkin period, -1 for unlimited

Enrollment.description: Schema representing a subscription that a customer has to a plan

id.description: Unique identifier for the plan

Plan.description: Schema representing a plan that a customer can purchase for access to a set of products/services

clientUuid.description: The company uuid in which the app is installed

installationId.description: The installation id of the app

id.description: Unique identifier for the reservation

reservedId.description: Unique identifier for the scheduled calendar event the registration is for

registrationTimestamp.description: Unix timestamp of when the registration was made

templateId.description: Unique identifier for the recurring reservation template

Reservation.description: Schema for representing a reservation for a class or event

id.description: Unique identifier for the checkin record

customer.description: UUID of the customer who checked in

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp representing the time of checkin

enrollmentId.description: UUID of the enrollment record, null if the checkin is not associated with a plan enrollment

name.description: Name of the event being checked into

kind.description: Type of check-in, which is always 'event'

role.description: Role of the customer at the event

id.description: UUID of the event type

type.description: Information about the type of the event

EventCheckin.description: Details of a customer's check-in for an event

id.description: Unique identifier for the checkin record

customer.description: UUID of the customer who checked in

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp representing the time of checkin

enrollmentId.description: UUID of the enrollment record, null if the checkin is not associated with a plan enrollment

kind.description: Indicates that this checkin is for an open facility

OpenCheckin.description: Schema representing an open facility checkin

id.description: A unique identifier for the company

subdomain.description: The subdomain associated with the company

postalCode.description: The postal code of the company

iso.description: The ISO code of the country

line1.description: The first line of the company address

line2.description: The second line of the company address

defaultTimezone.description: The default timezone of the company

phone.description: The contact phone number of the company

email.description: The contact email address of the company

url.description: The website URL of the company

Company.description: Represents an entity with one or more PushPress accounts, such as a gym, martial arts studio, or mermaid swim school

id.description: A unique identifier assigned to each customer

companyId.description: The unique identifier of the company the customer belongs to

first.description: The first name of the customer

last.description: The last name of the customer

nickname.description: What the customer prefers to be called

gender.description: The customer's gender, null if unknown or other

dob.description: The customer's date of birth, null if not provided, formatted YYYY-MM-DD

line1.description: The primary street address of the customer

line2.description: An additional street address line for the customer

city.description: The city where the customer resides

country.description: The country where the customer resides

state.description: The state or province where the customer resides

zip.description: The postal code of the customer's address

address.description: Customer address. Defaults to an empty string if no value is set.

assignedToStaffId.description: The UUID of the assigned staff member

primaryCustomerId.description: The UUID of the primary account

oneOf.description: A linked account may be linked to exactly one primary account. Linked accounts may have limited permissions and depend on the primary account for billing and other functionality.
A default full account is a primary account. It may have one or more linked accounts associated with it.

profileImage.description: A URL pointing to the customer's profile image

name.description: The name of the emergency contact

phone.description: The phone number of the emergency contact

relationship.description: The relationship of the emergency contact to the customer

initialMembershipStartDate.description: The date the customer first became a member

email.description: The email address of the customer

phone.description: The phone number of the customer

role.description: The role of the customer within the company (e.g., admin, coach, member)

Customer.description: Schema representing a customer, former customer, or lead served by the company

get.description: Retrieves a list of all active API keys associated with your account. The response includes metadata such as creation date, last used timestamp, and current status, helping you monitor key usage and manage access.

delete.description: Immediately invalidates an active API key, preventing any further authentication attempts using this key. This is useful when a key may have been compromised or is no longer needed. This action cannot be undone - a new key must be generated if access is needed again.

parameters.description: When using multitenant API keys, specify the company

patch.description: Immediately invalidates an active API key, preventing any further authentication attempts using this key. This is useful when a key may have been compromised or is no longer needed. This action cannot be undone - a new key must be generated if access is needed again.

post.description: Create a platform webhook that can be used to listen for events on the pushpress platform at a given URL

appId.description: Webhooks for application lifecycle events must be created with an app ID

url.description: The URL to send the webhook to

eventTypes.description: Webhooks registration must either apply to a set application events (e.g app.installed, app.uninstalled) or to customer events

parameters.name: company-id
parameters.description: When using multitenant API keys, specify the company

id.description: A unique identifier for the webhook

url.description: The endpoint URL that will receive the webhook payloads

appId.description: The app ID with which application lifecyle event types (e.g. app.installed) are associated

eventTypes.description: A list of event types that the webhook is subscribed to

active.description: Indicates whether the webhook is currently active and receiving events

signingSecret.description: A secret key used to sign the webhook payloads for security purposes

get.description: List platform webhooks for the current customer, including the signing secret and event subscriptions

tags.name: API Keys
tags.description: Manage programmatic access to the API through secure authentication keys. API keys serve as credentials for your application to authenticate requests to API endpoints. Each key can be individually tracked, managed, and revoked to maintain security and access control.

tags.name: Customers
tags.description: Access and manage customer profile information.

tags.name: Checkins
tags.description: Get the details of a class, event, or appointment checkin

tags.name: Manage Webhooks
tags.description: Create, update, delete, and list webhooks and events for real-time notifications and integrations.

tags.name: Apps
tags.description: Manage the app installation process, including installation, updates, and removal.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: Send Messages to App Users (internal use only)
